summary: This document is an email chain from January 2021 between Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team and a Bureau of Prisons (BOP) official regarding Maxwell's treatment while incarcerated. The lawyers complain about repeated delays in producing Maxwell for video court calls, excessive and inappropriate pat-down searches, unsanitary cleaning assignments, and other alleged petty harassment by guards, suggesting it may be retribution for prior complaints.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the correspondence; her legal team is advocating on her behalf regarding her conditions of confinement, including complaints about search procedures, production delays for court, and cleaning duties.

events.title: Complaints about Maxwell's delayed court appearances
events.description: Maxwell's lawyers note that for two consecutive days, she was not produced on time for her scheduled 12:30 PM video court calls, arriving at 12:59 PM and 12:47 PM respectively.

events.title: BOP official responds to complaints
events.description: A BOP official (signature redacted) responds to the lawyers' complaints, stating delays were compensated for, searches are consistent with policy, and that gloves and masks were recently provided.

events.title: Lawyers detail specific grievances
events.description: Maxwell's lawyers detail grievances including being ordered to clean a toilet without gloves at 6:40 AM (against handbook policy), being ordered to clean non-existent crumbs from her bed, and excessive 'ear searches' that increase COVID risk.

events.title: Formal request to modify pat-down searches
events.description: Maxwell's lawyers formally request that guards avoid touching her breasts during pat-downs and that she be permitted to wear her khaki v-neck top during searches to minimize exposure and vulnerability.

locations: Law Offices of [REDACTED], 4th Floor, New York, NY 10011
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team alleged she was subjected to 'repeated, inappropriate touching' of her breasts during daily pat-down searches while wearing a thin tee shirt.
The lawyers suggested delays in producing Maxwell for court and petty harassment (like ordering her to clean a toilet bare-handed) might be 'retribution for complaints made by counsel.'
A BOP official defended the procedures, stating searches were consistent with BOP Program Statement ยง 552.06 and that institutional emergencies sometimes caused schedule deviations.
The correspondence shows ongoing tension between Maxwell's defense team and prison officials regarding her conditions of confinement in January 2021, prior to her trial.
